sentences.en: The president of the United States is the commander-in-chief of the armed forces.
sentences.cn: 美国总统是武装部队的总司令。

sentences.en: Braunau was the chief headquarters of the commander-in-chief, Kutuzov.
sentences.cn: 库图佐夫总司令的大本营也坐落在布劳瑙。

sentences.en: IF THERE is one thing conservatives agree on, it is that Barack Obama is not tough enough to be commander-in-chief.
sentences.cn: 如果保守党在一件事上态度一致，那就是巴拉克·奥巴马还作为总司令还不够强硬。
